name: West Side Inn Hotel

reviews.title: Fawlty Towers Nearly killed my wife
reviews.text: I stayed here for one night with my wife and two young children as it was twenty minutes from the airport and we were flying home the next day to Ireland. I booked it online and was just looking for something cheap for one night so 79 euro suited. My first impressions of the area were not good, the hotel was situated in a ghetto area surrounded by high rise flats and some undesirable locals as we found on a trip to the nearest shops. The man at reception who checked us in was friendly and wished us a pleasant stay. The room was basic as expected with 3 star hotel, within minutes of entering the room the children hopped upon the beds and my wife decided to open the window to let some air in, what she wasn't expecting was the complete window panel 6ft by 4ft to come crashing in on top of her, luckily whatever way it landed she avoided serious injury and thankfully the children had been sitting on the beds at the time as the 2 year old would most certainly have been seriously injured. I lifted the complete window frame off her then went to reception to complain, they apologised and moved us to the room next door but didn't seem to appreciate how serious the incident was. We were just glad to get our heads down after a lot of travelling. The next morning we found that the hot water wasn't working in the shower which was disappointing, however the real surprise came after checking out whilst awaiting the shuttle bus to the airport. We were standing in the lobby and were approached by a man who informed us he was the Duty or General manager of the hotel. I was expecting him to state he was going to offer a full refund after our near death experience, but instead he started to accuse us of breaking the window, my wife became very upset at this and had to walk away, but he kept insisting that nothing like this had ever happened in the hotel and we must be at fault, I explained he was very lucky that no-one was killed as result of this faulty window and that we hardly even complained about the matter. He still insisted on laying the blame with us and I had to walk away myself as I could not believe his ignorance. I will never stay at this hotel again and would not recommend it to anyone even for one night!!! NQuinn (N Ireland)

reviews.title: Potential for Disappointment

reviews.text: I stayed in the HEM for one night with my girlfriend on a transfer flight from Amsterdam. My initial impressions were that the place was somewhat dodgy. We were in the main building, not the annex, but it wasn't very nice. Furnishings in the lobby and hallways were worn and drab, and nothing seemed as though it had been thoroughly cleaned. The staff were not very forthcoming with details during check-in and they required an inordinate amount of personal information to register, which I did not feel entirely comfortable providing. You pay upfront for your stay, but I was checking my credit statement online for days afterwards to make sure that I hadn't been hit with any unexpected charges -- I guess that best describes what kind of place I thought it to be. To be fair, there were none.
reviews.title: Not so good..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room itself left a similar impression. The overhead light didn't work, and though the bathroom wasn't filthy there was some hair and dust to indicate that it hadn't been cleaned well. The furnishings and carpet were similar to the lobby, and the bed coverings were somewhat worn and unappealing. The actual bed was two single mattresses pushed together, which is fairly common in lower-end European hotels but the room had been advertised as a double.

reviews.text: After seeing the bad reviews we were very scared but when we arrived we were greated by a very good looking obese receptionist who was very friendly. The shower did look like a tap but was ok once you had got over your 3rd degree burns. The gardens in the grounds were lovely just liek the ground force team had been in. The surrounding area was lovely with high quality luxury apartments all around we felt like we were back at home on our luxury Manchester ouncil estate. The only negative to our stay was the toilet it looked like it bleonged in a hospital

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The tram was a 300-400 mtr walk from the hotel through a housing estate which was not very nice. The tram went past a lot of the tourist spots like the Rilksmuseum, Van Goch museum and a few more. Beware of Taxi prices, we were ripped off by the taxis from Central station. On our first trip to the hotel it cost 17 euros but then we got fleeced and it cost 28. The best thing to get around with is buy a 24/48/72 hour pass at central station which gives you access to the buses and trams for the alloted period. We took a 72 hour one which cost 13 euros (one way tram ticket to Hem is 2.40).
reviews.title: Nice hotel - a little too far from centre though

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is on the outskirts of the ring, but was only a 5 minute walk to a tram station and then about a 15 minute ride to the city center. It was definitely worth it for the great deal and really wasn't a hassle at all. It was actually nice to be in the midst of the action and then take a short tram ride into the quiet little area the hotel was in. The rooms were big and decorated well (down comforters, TV, A/C). The area felt safe at pretty much all hours and I would definitely stay again. There's a lobby bar and place to get some food, but they close pretty early. If you like late night food/drinks, I would pick something up before heading back to the hotel. There's some great munchy food that a lot of the late night vendors would warm up and package in tinfoil for our commute back. I booked this hotel on Easytobook.com. I've also had a lot of good luck with European hotel deals on Bookings.com.

My Husband and I stayed at this hotel for five days, in October of 2007. The people at the front desk are very nice, they speak english. We got there very early b/c of our flight, and they allowed us to check in right away, for a charge of 15eur. Which was worth it, since we were tired. This hotel is very standard. I mean we had our own bathroom, which was good for European standards, so no sharing. And two twin beds pushed together. They werent the most comfy, but they did the job. This location was also ok. It was a short walk to Vondel Park, which is about a 20 min walk (which is amazing) to the center of the city, right at Van Gogh etc...which was very cool. You can also easily take the tram. So location was good for us, since it was away from the hustle and buslt and it was much cheaper! There is a little bar and resataurant there, which was very good. Plus there is a little shopping area you walk to. THey have a liquore store, restaurants, bakeries, shops etc...We felt very safe in this area. And walked around at all times of the day, night or day. We were happy w/ the hotel, no complaints at all. I mean its about a 2.5 star hotel, which was fine. We literally were out of there at 9am and most days didnt return until 9pm. so for sleeping it was GREAT, very quiet. If you are a type of person who likes to go back and forth to the hotel and everywhere else, then it might a bit out of the way....but if its just for sleeping, why not! It was safe, very clean (rooms) the halls were a little dirty LOOKING, b/c they are old...plus this use to be a police acadamy (so we were told) so its got reason for being run down....But we liked it, it was a good price, clean, quiet, good neighbourhood...
reviews.title: Reasonably priced

reviews.text: NOW for AMSTERDAM in itself...OMG GREAT CITY! The nicest people i have ever met, everyone was soooooo helpful! We had a blast!! We saw a lot in the little time we were there, but really three days is enough to see the whole city...FUN FUN FUN!

description: West Side Inn Amsterdam is perfectly situated in the South West part of Amsterdam, next to the main highway the A10. Schiphol Airport, World Fashion Centre, World Trade Centre and RAI Congress Hall are only 15 minutes away. West Side Inn Amsterdam can easily be reached by public transportation or by car, which you can park in our own parking lot.
